oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Bilinear Decompositions of Products of Hardy and Lipschitz Spaces Through Wavelets
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Cao, Jun
Ky, Luong Dang
Yang, Dachun
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Classical Analysis and ODEs
Mathematics - Functional Analysis
Primary: 42B30, Secondary: 42B35, 46E30, 42C40
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The aim of this article is to give a complete solution to the problem of the bilinear decompositions of the products of some Hardy spaces $H^p(\mathbb{R}^n)$ and their duals in the case when $p<1$ and near to $1$, via wavelets, paraproducts and the theory of bilinear Calder\'on-Zygmund operators. Precisely, the authors establish the bilinear decompositions of the product spaces $H^p(\mathbb{R}^n)\times\dot\Lambda_{\alpha} (\mathbb{R}^n)$ and $H^p(\mathbb{R}^n)\times\Lambda_{\alpha}(\mathbb{R}^n)$, where, for all $p\in(\frac{n}{n+1},\,1)$ and $\alpha:=n(\frac{1}{p}-1)$, $H^p(\mathbb{R}^n)$ denotes the classical real Hardy space, and $\dot\Lambda_{\alpha}$ and $\Lambda_{\alpha}$ denote the homogeneous, respectively, the inhomogeneous Lipschitz spaces. Sharpness of these two bilinear decompositions are also proved. As an application, the authors establish some div-curl lemmas at the endpoint case.
Comment: We divide the article arXiv: 1510.04384 into two articles. This is the first part
